oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Limit Password Reuse
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The passwords to remember should be set correctly.

oval-def:criteria.comment: Check if pam_pwhistory.so or pam_unix.so are configured
Check if pam_pwhistory.so is properly configured

oval-def:criterion.comment: pam_pwhistory.so is properly defined in password section of PAM file

oval-def:criteria.comment: Check the expected value for pam_pwhistory.so remember parameter
Check the pam_pwhistory.so remember parameter is only in PAM file

oval-def:criterion.comment: Check the remember parameter in password section of PAM file
Check the pam_pwhistory.so remember parameter is absent in pwhistory.conf

oval-def:criteria.comment: Check the pam_pwhistory.so remember parameter is only in pwhistory.conf file

oval-def:criterion.comment: Check the pam_pwhistory.so remember parameter is absent in PAM file
Remember parameter of pam_unix.so is properly configured

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Set Interactive Session Timeout
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Checks interactive shell timeout

oval-def:criterion.comment: At least one config file has TMOUT defined

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure the Default Bash Umask is Set Correctly
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The default umask for users of the bash shell

oval-def:extend_definition.comment: Get value of var_accounts_user_umask variable as octal number

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure the Default Umask is Set Correctly in login.defs
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The default umask for all users specified in /etc/login.defs

oval-def:extend_definition.comment: Get value of var_accounts_user_umask variable as octal number

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure the Default Umask is Set Correctly in /etc/profile
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The default umask for all users should be set correctly

oval-def:extend_definition.comment: get value of var_accounts_user_umask variable as octal number

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure PAM Enforces Password Requirements - Minimum Digit Characters
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The password dcredit should meet minimum requirements

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure PAM Enforces Password Requirements - Minimum Lowercase Characters
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The password lcredit should meet minimum requirements

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure PAM Enforces Password Requirements - Minimum Length
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The password minlen should meet minimum requirements

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure PAM Enforces Password Requirements - Minimum Special Characters
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The password ocredit should meet minimum requirements

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure PAM Enforces Password Requirements - Minimum Uppercase Characters
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The password ucredit should meet minimum requirements

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Verify Group Who Owns gshadow File
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: This test makes sure that /etc/gshadow is group owned by 0.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Verify Group Who Owns shadow File
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: This test makes sure that /etc/shadow is group owned by 0.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Verify User Who Owns gshadow File
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: This test makes sure that /etc/gshadow is owned by 0.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Verify User Who Owns shadow File
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: This test makes sure that /etc/shadow is owned by 0.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Verify Permissions on gshadow File
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: This test makes sure that /etc/gshadow has mode 0000. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Verify Permissions on shadow File
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: This test makes sure that /etc/shadow has mode 0000. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure sudo Runs In A Minimal Environment - sudo env_reset
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Checks sudoers Defaults {{ OPTION }} configuration

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure sudo Ignores Commands In Current Dir - sudo ignore_dot
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Checks sudoers Defaults {{ OPTION }} configuration

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure Privileged Escalated Commands Cannot Execute Other Commands - sudo NOEXEC
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Checks sudoers Defaults {{ OPTION }} configuration

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure Only Users Logged In To Real tty Can Execute Sudo - sudo requiretty
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Checks sudoers Defaults {{ OPTION }} configuration

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure sudo umask is appropriate - sudo umask
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Checks sudoers Defaults {{ OPTION }} configuration

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure Only Users Logged In To Real tty Can Execute Sudo - sudo use_pty
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Checks sudoers Defaults {{ OPTION }} configuration

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Check pam_pwquality Existence in system-auth
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Check that pam_pwquality.so exists in system-auth

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Value of 'var_accounts_user_umask' variable represented as octal number
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Value of 'var_accounts_user_umask' variable represented as octal number

ind:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Check pam_pwhistory.so presence in PAM file
Check remember parameter is present and correct in PAM file
Check the absence of remember parameter in /etc/security/pwhistory.conf
Check remember parameter is absent in PAM file
Check remember parameter is present and correct in /etc/security/pwhistory.conf
Test if remember attribute of pam_unix.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

ind:variable_test.comment: Check that at least one TMOUT is defined
Test the retrieved /etc/bashrc umask value(s) match the var_accounts_user_umask requirement
Test the retrieved /etc/login.defs umask value(s) match the var_accounts_user_umask requirement
umask value(s) from profile configuration files match the requirement
Verify the existence of var_accounts_user_umask_as_number variable

umask value retrieved from profile configuration files
